ygData.subject: Re: [The EverQuest Tavern] WANT EQ
ygData.msgSnippet: Really? Because personally, I have a 56k, and at first I had problems with spells, but after my 5th spell, there was no lag at all! PsyKo
ygData.messageBody:
Really? Because personally, I have a 56k, and at first I had problems with spells, but after my 5th spell, there was no lag at all!
PsyKo <sibilant_ghost@...> wrote:Correction On an error Actually the legal limit in
place on dial up speed is 115k which is available
using a tweaked 56k modem. I am running AOL atm at
115k once got it up to 234k but I recieved an
interesting E-Mail from an unknown source telling me
my speed had been cut back down to 115k... But, as
long as i stay off during peak hours AKA 60ppl per
zone, im fine. My advice for using a 56k modem tho is
fight as a melee only class... spells are a great
source of lag, and Good Luck if you wanna try playing
a bard LMAO that was my first mistake. GL and Have
fun, Marshun PsyKo


--- bullions27 <no_reply@yahoogroups.com> wrote:
> To break it down into layman's terms, the game
> relies heavily on data
> transfer between your PC and its server. Therefore,
> connection speed
> is paramount. ;) Dial-up is one of the slowest
> connections you can
> have (if you use AOL I pity you).
>
> If you really want to spend the money, you could
> upgrade to DSL. It's
> roughly about the same price you'll pay for AOL
> (depending on where
> you get DSL from), or if you have Cable service
> available, get that.
> Dial-up transfers up to 56K per second. DSL and
> Cable are 10 times
> faster than that and more if you have a good modem
> and cable.
>
> ***********************
> Jack Bullions
>
>
> > It works on dialup, but my boyfriend got cable
> modem to play
> recently and he LOVES it even more now, I am still
> stuck with dialup
> and see the different in speed and most defidently
> graphics.
> > BADBRAD112 <badbrad112@y...> wrote:Hi everyone, i
> just wanted to
> ask some questions. Does this game work well at all
> using dail up,
> cause thats all i got right now and i was wonering
> if i am gonna need
> to upgrade to cable internet to play this game, if
> any of you out
> there use dail up, does it run fast or what?
> >
> > thanks
>
>
>
